duck: The condition or quality of being or keeping still and silent.
silenced definition: to compel or reduce to silence.

{{Infobox Korean film | name = The Crucible name = Silenced image = The Crucible-poster.jpg image size | = 200px caption = Promotional poster for The Crucible hangul = hanja = rr = | Dogani mr = Togani context = director = Hwang Dong-hyuk producer = Uhm Yong- | hun
Bae Jeong-min
Na Byung-joon based on = The Crucible by Gong Ji- | young (novel) screenplay = Hwang Dong-hyuk story = narrator = starring = Gong | Yoo
Jung Yoo-mi music = cinematography = editing = studio = Samgeori | Pictures distributor = CJ Entertainment released = runtime = country = South | Korea language = Korean budget = admissions = | 4,662,822[http://www.koreanfilm.org/kfilm11.html#silenced Silenced] | Koreanfilm.org. gross = $30,723,856[http://boxofficemojo.com/movie- | s/intl/?id=_fCRUCIBLE201&country=KR&wk=2011W40&id=_fCRUCIBLE201&p=.htm Dogani | (Crucible)] Boxofficemojo. }} 'The Crucible' () is a 2011 South Korean film based on the novel of the same name by Gong Ji- young,[http://koreajoongangdaily.joinsmsn.com/news/article/html/321/29- 41321.html Fueled by need for fresh material, best-sellers become box office hits] JoongAng Daily. 9 September 2011. starring Gong Yoo and Jung Yoo- mi. It is based on actual events that took place at Gwangju Inhwa School for the hearing-impaired, where young deaf students were the victims of repeated sexual assaults by faculty members over a period of five years in the early 2000s.[http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2011/09/28/2011092- 801311.html "'The Crucible' Brings Demons of Child Molestation Case Back to Life"] Chosun Ilbo. 28 September 2011. Retrieved 2011-10- 15[http://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/art/2011/08/135_93389.ht- ml Film examines child abuse case] Korea Times. 24 August 2011. Retrieved 2012-04-25 Depicting both the crimes and the court proceedings that let the teachers off with minimal punishment, the film sparked public outrage upon its September 2011 release, which eventually resulted in a reopening of the investigations into the incidents. With over 4 million people in Korea having watched the film, the demand for legislative reform reached all the way to the National Assembly, where a revised bill, dubbed the Dogani Bill, was passed in late October 2011 to abolish the statute of limitations for sex crimes against minors and the disabled.
wiki.title: The%20Crucible%20%282011%20film%29
